summary_reasoning: Assumptions are mostly explicit and proximate to the forecasts (revenue, margins, WACC, terminal growth) with clear magnitudes, ranges, and horizons. Specificity is solid: the report quantifies revenue growth paths, margin levels, cost of capital parameters, terminal growth, tax rate, and share count. Justification is partial: FY2025 revenue growth ties to company guidance and gross margin to historical SEC figures, but the multi-year slowing growth, operating margin expansion to 15%, WACC/COE inputs, terminal growth, and share count lack peer/industry or sourced support. Internal consistency has a notable contradiction: WACC/COE/beta are inconsistent between sections (beta ~1.2 vs ~1.1; COE ~10% vs implied ~11.1% from Rf/ERP; WACC 9% despite “no debt”), triggering a cap at Fair. Stress-testing is limited: only a single quantified sensitivity on WACC (+0.5%) with a broad 5–10% FVE impact and an unquantified “slower growth” case; no scenarios for revenue, margins, or subscription mix. Overall, the assumptions are explicit and specific but weakly justified and inconsistently documented for cost of capital, with minimal sensitivity analysis.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Our valuation model assumes revenue grows at ~15% in FY2025 (middle of guidance), gradually slowing to ~7–8% by FY2029 as the company becomes larger. We forecast 2024–2029 CAGR of ~10%.
Gross margin holds around 74–75%, as services mix rises.
We posit operating margin (non-GAAP) climbing to ~15% by 2029 (from ~8.5% in FY2024) as fixed costs scale and R&D investments moderate.
For our DCF, we assume WACC ≈9% (cost of equity ~10% with ~1.2 beta, no debt)

contradictions.description: Cost of capital inputs are inconsistent: beta ~1.2 vs ~1.1; COE ~10% vs implied ~11.1% from Rf 4.5% and ERP 6%; WACC 9% despite ‘no debt’.

unjustified_parameters: operating margin to ~15% by 2029 without peer/history support
